articles.title: Portug√°l n√°szutas utaz√°si kifejez√©sek
articles.content:
import VocabCard from '@components/VocabCard.astro';

A n√°sz√∫t a h√°zass√°g els≈ë romantikus utaz√°sa. Ha portug√°l nyelvter√ºletre utaztok, ezek a kifejez√©sek seg√≠tenek eligazodni.

Az alapvet≈ë kifejez√©sek√©rt n√©zd meg az [Portug√°l k√∂sz√∂n√©sek √©s b√∫cs√∫z√°sok](/learn/hu/pt/portuguese-greetings-and-farewells) √∫tmutat√≥nkat.

<PhraseOfDay
  word="Parab√©ns!"
  translation="Gratul√°lok!"
  pronunciation="p…ê…æ…êÀàŒ≤…êÃÉj É"
  context="Az esk√ºv≈ëi k√∂sz√∂nt√©s alapja."

## Alapvet≈ë sz√≥kincs

A n√°szutas utaz√°s alapvet≈ë portug√°l kifejez√©sei:

<VocabCard

| Portug√°l | Magyar | Haszn√°lat |
|---|---|---|
| noiva | menyasszony | A n≈ë |
| noivo | v≈ëleg√©ny | A f√©rfi |
| votos | fogadalmak | Esk√ºv≈ëi √≠g√©retek |
| cerim√≥nia | szertart√°s | A hivatalos r√©sz |
| rece√ß√£o | fogad√°s | Az √ºnnepl√©s |
| brinde | k√∂sz√∂nt≈ë | Poh√°rk√∂sz√∂nt≈ë |

<CultureTip flag="üåç" title="Portug√°l kultur√°lis tippek">
Ha portug√°l nyelvter√ºletre utaztok n√°sz√∫tra, a helyi nyelv alapjainak ismerete sokkal gazdagabb√° teheti az √©lm√©nyt. A helyiek √©rt√©kelni fogj√°k az er≈ëfesz√≠t√©st.

## Hasznos kifejez√©sek

### Utaz√°si alapkifejez√©sek

A n√°sz√∫t alatt hasznos mondatok:

- **N√°sz√∫ton vagyunk!** - A k√ºl√∂nleges alkalom megoszt√°sa
- **Szob√°t foglaltunk** - Sz√°llod√°ban
- **Romantikus vacsor√°t szeretn√©nk** - √âtteremben

### Romantikus helyzetek
A n√°sz√∫t k√ºl√∂nleges pillanataira:

- **Gy√∂ny√∂r≈± ez a hely!** - Lelkesed√©s kifejez√©se

<VocabCard

## Gyakorlati helyzetek

| Helyzet | Mit mondj |
|---|---|

<CultureTip flag="üí°" title="Hasznos tipp">
T√∂lts le egy nyelvtanul√≥s alkalmaz√°st a n√°sz√∫tra. M√©g az alapvet≈ë kifejez√©sek ismerete is nagy k√ºl√∂nbs√©get jelent az utaz√°s sor√°n.

## √ñsszefoglal√≥ t√°bl√°zat

| Helyzet | Portug√°l kifejez√©s |

## Tov√°bbi tanul√°s

Ha tov√°bb szeretn√©d fejleszteni a portug√°l nyelvtud√°sod, n√©zd meg ezeket a cikkeinket:

- [Portug√°l alapvet≈ë kifejez√©sek p√°roknak](/learn/hu/pt/portuguese-essential-phrases-for-couples)

Ezek a forr√°sok seg√≠tenek elm√©ly√≠teni a tud√°sod √©s magabiztosabb√° v√°lni a portug√°l nyelvben.

articles.title: Expresii de CƒÉlƒÉtorie pentru Luna de Miere √Æn OlandezƒÉ: Ghid pentru
articles.content:
import VocabCard from '@components/VocabCard.astro';
import CultureTip from '@components/CultureTip.astro';
import PhraseOfDay from '@components/PhraseOfDay.astro';
import CTA from '@components/CTA.astro';

Luna de miere este cƒÉlƒÉtoria vie»õii voastre ca proaspƒÉt cƒÉsƒÉtori»õi. Acest ghid te va ajuta sƒÉ √Ænve»õi expresiile esen»õiale pentru a face aceastƒÉ experien»õƒÉ »ôi mai specialƒÉ.

Pentru expresii romantice de bazƒÉ, consultƒÉ [expresii romantice pentru fiecare ocazie](/learn/ro/nl/nl-romantic-phrases-for-every-occasion).

<PhraseOfDay
  word="Suntem √Æn luna de miere!"
  translation="We're on our honeymoon!"
  pronunciation="anun»õ fericit"
  context="Spune-le tuturor cƒÉ sƒÉrbƒÉtori»õi dragostea!"
/>

## Vocabular de BazƒÉ

<VocabCard
  word="luna de miere"
  translation="honeymoon"
  pronunciation="cƒÉlƒÉtorie romanticƒÉ"
  example="Luna noastrƒÉ de miere e √Æn Grecia."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="rezervare"
  translation="reservation/booking"
  pronunciation="programare"
  example="Am fƒÉcut rezervarea pentru hotel."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="camerƒÉ pentru cupluri"
  translation="couple's room"
  pronunciation="cazare romanticƒÉ"
  example="Am rezervat camera pentru cupluri."
/>

### Termeni Esen»õiali de CƒÉlƒÉtorie

| Rom√¢nƒÉ | Context |
|--------|--------|
| Zbor | Transport aerian |
| Hotel | Cazare |
| Bagaj | Lucruri personale |
| Pa»ôaport | Document de cƒÉlƒÉtorie |
| VizƒÉ | Permis de intrare |
| Asigurare | Protec»õie cƒÉlƒÉtorie |

<CultureTip flag="‚úàÔ∏è" title="Destina»õii Populare">
Cele mai populare destina»õii pentru luna de miere includ: Maldive (plaje paradisiace), Paris (romantism), Italia (culturƒÉ »ôi m√¢ncare), Grecia (insule), Bali (exotic), »ôi Hawaii (aventurƒÉ). Alege»õi √Æn func»õie de preferin»õele voastre ca cuplu.
</CultureTip>

## La Hotel

<VocabCard
  word="Am o rezervare."
  translation="I have a reservation."
  pronunciation="la recep»õie"
  example="BunƒÉ ziua, am o rezervare pe numele..."
/>

### Expresii pentru Check-in
- **Am o rezervare pe numele...** - I have a reservation under the name...
- **Suntem √Æn luna de miere** - We're on our honeymoon
- **Avem camerƒÉ cu vedere?** - Do we have a room with a view?
- **La ce orƒÉ e check-out?** - What time is check-out?

### FacilitƒÉ»õi de Hotel
| Facilitate | Descriere |
|------------|----------|
| PiscinƒÉ | Relaxare |
| Spa | Tratamente |
| Restaurant | M√¢ncare |
| Room service | Servire √Æn camerƒÉ |
| Concierge | Asisten»õƒÉ |
| WiFi | Internet |

### Cereri Speciale
- **E posibil sƒÉ avem »ôampanie √Æn camerƒÉ?** - decora»õiuni romantice
- **Putem rezerva o masƒÉ romanticƒÉ?** - cinƒÉ specialƒÉ
- **Ave»õi pachete pentru cupluri?** - oferte speciale

<VocabCard
  word="Aceasta e luna noastrƒÉ de miere."
  translation="This is our honeymoon."
  pronunciation="men»õion√¢nd ocazia"
  example="Aceasta e luna noastrƒÉ de miere - ave»õi ceva special?"
/>

## La Restaurant

### Expresii de BazƒÉ
| Rom√¢nƒÉ | Utilizare |
|--------|----------|
| O masƒÉ pentru doi, vƒÉ rog | Rezervare |
| Meniul, vƒÉ rog | ComandƒÉ |
| Ce recomanda»õi? | Sfaturi |
| Nota, vƒÉ rog | PlatƒÉ |
| A fost delicios! | Mul»õumire |

### CinƒÉ RomanticƒÉ
- **Ave»õi o masƒÉ mai intimƒÉ?** - pentru atmosferƒÉ
- **Ce vin recomanda»õi?** - pentru a acompania m√¢ncarea
- **SƒÉrbƒÉtorim luna de miere** - pentru aten»õie specialƒÉ

<CultureTip flag="üçΩÔ∏è" title="Cultura CulinarƒÉ">
Fiecare destina»õie are specialitƒÉ»õi locale. √én Italia, savura»õi pasta proaspƒÉtƒÉ. √én Grecia, √Æncerca»õi meze. √én Fran»õa, nu rata»õi br√¢nzeturile »ôi vinurile. Explorarea culinarƒÉ poate fi o parte minunatƒÉ a lunii de miere.
</CultureTip>

## Transport »ôi Explorare

### Mijloace de Transport
| Transport | C√¢nd sƒÉ folose»ôti |
|-----------|------------------|
| Taxi | Distan»õe scurte |
| √énchiriat ma»ôinƒÉ | Libertate de explorare |
| Transport public | Experien»õƒÉ localƒÉ |
| BarcƒÉ/Ferry | Destina»õii insulare |
| Avion intern | Distan»õe mari |

### Expresii Utile
- **C√¢t costƒÉ p√¢nƒÉ la...?** - How much to...?
- **Pute»õi sƒÉ ne recomanda»õi...?** - Can you recommend...?
- **C√¢t dureazƒÉ?** - How long does it take?
- **Unde putem gƒÉsi...?** - Where can we find...?

<VocabCard
  word="Ce locuri romantice recomanda»õi?"
  translation="What romantic places do you recommend?"
  pronunciation="cer√¢nd sfaturi"
  example="Suntem √Æn luna de miere. Ce locuri romantice recomanda»õi?"
/>

## ActivitƒÉ»õi pentru Cupluri

### Romantice
| Activitate | Descriere |
|------------|----------|
| Apus de soare | Privi»õi √ÆmpreunƒÉ |
| Plimbare pe plajƒÉ | √én doi |
| CinƒÉ la lumina lum√¢nƒÉrilor | SearƒÉ specialƒÉ |
| Masaj pentru cupluri | Relaxare |
| CroazierƒÉ privatƒÉ | AventurƒÉ pe apƒÉ |

### Aventuroase
| Activitate | Pentru cine |
|------------|------------|
| ScufundƒÉri | Iubitori de mare |
| Drume»õii | NaturƒÉ |
| Safari | Africa |
| Zip-line | AdrenalinƒÉ |
| ParapantƒÉ | Vedere aerianƒÉ |

## Fotografii »ôi Amintiri

### Expresii pentru Fotografii
- **Ne pute»õi face o pozƒÉ?** - Can you take our photo?
- **Aici e perfect pentru o pozƒÉ** - This is perfect for a photo
- **Mai una, vƒÉ rog!** - One more, please!

### Documentarea CƒÉlƒÉtoriei
- Jurnal de cƒÉlƒÉtorie
- Album foto
- Video clips
- Suveniruri locale
- CƒÉr»õi po»ôtale

<CultureTip flag="üì∏" title="Pozele de Luna de Miere">
Mul»õi cupluri angajeazƒÉ un fotograf profesionist pentru o sesiune foto √Æn destina»õie. Plajele la apus, strƒÉzile pitore»ôti sau monumentele celebre pot fi cadrul perfect pentru amintiri de neuitat.
</CultureTip>

## √én Caz de Urgen»õƒÉ

### Numere »ôi Expresii Utile
| Situa»õie | Ac»õiune |
|----------|--------|
| Urgen»õƒÉ medicalƒÉ | Suna»õi ambulan»õa |
| Pa»ôaport pierdut | AmbasadƒÉ/Consulat |
| Bagaj pierdut | Reclama»õie la aeroport |
| Probleme cu rezervarea | Contacta»õi agen»õia |

### Expresii de Urgen»õƒÉ
- **Am nevoie de ajutor** - I need help
- **Unde e cel mai apropiat spital?** - Where is the nearest hospital?
- **Am pierdut...** - I lost...
- **Pute»õi sƒÉ mƒÉ ajuta»õi?** - Can you help me?

## Sfaturi Finale

1. **Planifica»õi √ÆmpreunƒÉ** - ambii parteneri sƒÉ contribuie
2. **LƒÉsa»õi loc pentru spontaneitate** - cele mai bune amintiri sunt neplanificate
3. **Deconecta»õi-vƒÉ** - limita»õi telefonul »ôi re»õelele sociale
4. **Spune»õi cƒÉ sunte»õi √Æn luna de miere** - adesea primi»õi tratament special
5. **Bucura»õi-vƒÉ de fiecare moment** - e o experien»õƒÉ unicƒÉ

<CTA />

## Concluzie

Luna de miere e √Ænceputul cƒÉlƒÉtoriei voastre ca so»õ »ôi so»õie. Cu acest vocabular »ôi aceste expresii, ve»õi putea sƒÉ naviga»õi orice destina»õie »ôi sƒÉ crea»õi amintiri de neuitat √ÆmpreunƒÉ.

Drum bun »ôi vacan»õƒÉ plƒÉcutƒÉ!

articles.title: Schwedisch Kosenamen und Liebkosungen f√ºr Paare
articles.content:
import VocabCard from '@components/VocabCard.astro';
import CultureTip from '@components/CultureTip.astro';
import CTA from '@components/CTA.astro';

# Schwedisch Kosenamen und Liebkosungen f√ºr Paare

Kosenamen sind eine wunderbare Art, deinem Partner zu zeigen, wie viel er oder sie dir bedeutet. Wenn dein Partner Schwedisch spricht, wird es ihn oder sie sicher freuen, wenn du diese liebevollen Ausdr√ºcke verwendest!

## Warum Kosenamen wichtig sind

Kosenamen schaffen Intimit√§t und zeigen Zuneigung. Sie sind wie ein geheimes Band zwischen zwei Menschen ‚Äì etwas Besonderes, das nur euch beiden geh√∂rt.

## Klassische Kosenamen

Die zeitlosen Klassiker funktionieren in jeder Sprache:

- **Schatz** - der universelle Liebling
- **Liebling** - klassisch und elegant
- **Mein Herz** - gef√ºhlvoll und poetisch
- **Meine Liebe** - romantisch und z√§rtlich

<CultureTip>
Kosenamen variieren oft von Region zu Region. Was in einer Gegend √ºblich ist, kann anderswo ungew√∂hnlich klingen. Frage deinen Partner, welche Namen in seiner Heimat gebr√§uchlich sind!
</CultureTip>

## S√º√üe Tiernamen

Wie in vielen Kulturen werden auch im Schwedischen gerne Tiernamen verwendet:

- **B√§rchen** (kleiner B√§r) - kuschelig und stark
- **M√§uschen** (kleine Maus) - s√º√ü und niedlich
- **H√§schen** (kleiner Hase) - z√§rtlich
- **Sp√§tzchen** (kleiner Spatz) - liebevoll

## Romantische Ausdr√ºcke

F√ºr besondere Momente:

- **Mein Ein und Alles** - wenn jemand alles f√ºr dich ist
- **Seelenverwandter** - f√ºr tiefe Verbindungen
- **Mein Sonnenschein** - f√ºr jemanden, der dein Leben erhellt

## Kosenamen f√ºr verschiedene Anl√§sse

### Im Alltag
Kurze, lockere Namen f√ºr den t√§glichen Gebrauch. Ein schnelles "Hey, Schatz!" funktioniert immer.

### F√ºr romantische Momente
L√§ngere, gef√ºhlvollere Ausdr√ºcke passen zu besonderen Momenten. Sag deinem Partner, was er oder sie dir bedeutet.

### Zum Necken
Humorvolle Kosenamen k√∂nnen eure Beziehung auflockern ‚Äì aber achte darauf, dass dein Partner den Humor teilt!

## Tipps zur Verwendung

1. **Frage deinen Partner**: Nicht jeder mag jeden Kosenamen. Frage, was ihm/ihr gef√§llt.
2. **Achte auf die Aussprache**: √úbe die richtige Aussprache ‚Äì nichts ist romantischer als ein korrekt ausgesprochener Kosename.
3. **Sei authentisch**: Verwende Namen, die zu euch als Paar passen.
4. **Kreiere eigene Namen**: Die pers√∂nlichsten Kosenamen sind oft selbst erfunden!
5. **Beobachte die Reaktion**: Der beste Kosename ist der, bei dem dein Partner l√§chelt.

## Die Kraft der Sprache

Kosenamen sind mehr als Worte ‚Äì sie sind kleine Liebeserkl√§rungen im Alltag. Wenn du Schwedisch lernst, um mit deinem Partner zu kommunizieren, sind Kosenamen ein wundervoller Anfang.

<CTA />

articles.title: 50 Danish Compliments for Your Partner
articles.content:
import VocabCard from '@components/VocabCard.astro';
import CultureTip from '@components/CultureTip.astro';
import PhraseOfDay from '@components/PhraseOfDay.astro';
import CTA from '@components/CTA.astro';

Danes are known for their cozy "hygge" lifestyle and, despite their reserved exterior, have a rich vocabulary for expressing love and admiration. Learning to compliment your Danish partner in their native language will create special moments of connection.

## The Most Beautiful Compliment

<PhraseOfDay
  word="Du er fantastisk"
  translation="You are fantastic"
  pronunciation="doo air fan-TAS-tisk"
  context="A heartfelt compliment that Danes truly appreciate. Simple, genuine, and meaningful."
/>

In Danish culture, sincere and understated compliments carry more weight than elaborate flattery. When you mean what you say, your Danish partner will feel it deeply.

## Complimenting Appearance

### For Women

<VocabCard
  word="Du er smuk"
  translation="You are beautiful"
  pronunciation="doo air smook"
  example="Du er sa smuk i dag!"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Du er dejlig"
  translation="You are lovely"
  pronunciation="doo air DAI-li"
  example="Du ser dejlig ud!"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Du er fortryllende"
  translation="You are enchanting"
  pronunciation="doo air for-TRUL-en-e"
  example="Du er helt fortryllende!"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Du er stralende"
  translation="You are radiant"
  pronunciation="doo air STROH-len-e"
  example="Du er stralende i aften!"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Du er vidunderlig"
  translation="You are wonderful"
  pronunciation="doo air vee-DOON-er-lee"
  example="Du er simpelthen vidunderlig!"
/>

### For Men

<VocabCard
  word="Du er flot"
  translation="You are handsome"
  pronunciation="doo air flot"
  example="Du er virkelig flot!"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Du er attraktiv"
  translation="You are attractive"
  pronunciation="doo air at-trak-TEEV"
  example="Du er en attraktiv mand."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Du er st√¶rk"
  translation="You are strong"
  pronunciation="doo air stairk"
  example="Du er sa st√¶rk!"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Du er elegant"
  translation="You are elegant"
  pronunciation="doo air e-le-GANT"
  example="Du ser elegant ud i aften!"
/>

<CultureTip title="Danish Janteloven" flag="üá©üá∞">
Danes follow "Janteloven" - an unwritten code of humility. Your partner may downplay compliments, but they're still deeply appreciated. Keep giving them - genuine words of affirmation mean everything!
</CultureTip>

## Complimenting Specific Features

### Eyes

<VocabCard
  word="Du har smukke √∏jne"
  translation="You have beautiful eyes"
  pronunciation="doo har SMOO-ke OY-ne"
  example="Du har sa smukke √∏jne!"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Jeg drukner i dine √∏jne"
  translation="I'm drowning in your eyes"
  pronunciation="yai DROOK-ner ee DEE-ne OY-ne"
  example="A deeply romantic expression."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Dine √∏jne lyser som stjerner"
  translation="Your eyes shine like stars"
  pronunciation="DEE-ne OY-ne LOO-ser som SHARE-ner"
  example="Romantic and poetic!"
/>

### Smile

<VocabCard
  word="Du har et smukt smil"
  translation="You have a beautiful smile"
  pronunciation="doo har et smookt smeel"
  example="Dit smil lyser op i rummet."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Du er smuk, nar du smiler"
  translation="You're beautiful when you smile"
  pronunciation="doo air smook, nohr doo SMEE-ler"
  example="Express your affection."
/>

### Voice

<VocabCard
  word="Du har en smuk stemme"
  translation="You have a beautiful voice"
  pronunciation="doo har en smook STEM-me"
  example="Jeg elsker at h√∏re dig tale."
/>

## Personality Compliments

### Kindness and Character

<VocabCard
  word="Du er s√∏d"
  translation="You are sweet/kind"
  pronunciation="doo air sud"
  example="Du er sa s√∏d mod alle."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Du er omsorgsfuld"
  translation="You are caring"
  pronunciation="doo air om-SORGS-fool"
  example="Du er en omsorgsfuld partner."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Du er k√¶rlig"
  translation="You are loving"
  pronunciation="doo air SHARE-lee"
  example="Du er sa k√¶rlig."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Du har et hjerte af guld"
  translation="You have a heart of gold"
  pronunciation="doo har et YAIR-te av goold"
  example="A beautiful expression of admiration."
/>

### Intelligence and Talent

<VocabCard
  word="Du er klog"
  translation="You are smart"
  pronunciation="doo air klow"
  example="Du er sa klog!"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Du er talentfuld"
  translation="You are talented"
  pronunciation="doo air ta-LENT-fool"
  example="Du er utrolig talentfuld!"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Du er genial"
  translation="You are a genius"
  pronunciation="doo air ye-ni-AL"
  example="Den ide er genial, ligesom dig!"
/>

### Humor and Fun

<VocabCard
  word="Du er sjov"
  translation="You are funny"
  pronunciation="doo air show"
  example="Du er sa sjov!"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Det er sjovt at v√¶re sammen med dig"
  translation="It's fun being with you"
  pronunciation="det air showt at VAI-re SA-men med dey"
  example="Det er altid sjovt med dig!"
/>

<CultureTip title="Danish Hygge" flag="üá©üá∞">
"Hygge" is at the heart of Danish culture - cozy, warm moments with loved ones. Compliments shared during hygge moments (candlelit dinners, cozy evenings) feel even more special. Create hygge together and let the sweet words flow!
</CultureTip>

## Romantic Compliments

<VocabCard
  word="Du er min lykke"
  translation="You are my happiness"
  pronunciation="doo air meen LOO-ke"
  example="Du er al min lykke."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Du g√∏r mig lykkelig"
  translation="You make me happy"
  pronunciation="doo yur mey LOO-ke-lee"
  example="Hver dag g√∏r du mig lykkelig."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Du er det bedste, der er sket for mig"
  translation="You're the best thing that's happened to me"
  pronunciation="doo air det BES-te, dehr air sket for mey"
  example="The ultimate romantic compliment."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Jeg er stolt af dig"
  translation="I'm proud of you"
  pronunciation="yai air stolt af dey"
  example="Jeg er sa stolt af dig!"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Med dig f√∏ler jeg mig speciel"
  translation="With you I feel special"
  pronunciation="med dey FUH-ler yai mey spe-si-EL"
  example="Express how they make you feel."
/>

## Complimenting Actions and Efforts

<VocabCard
  word="Du laver himmelsk mad"
  translation="You cook heavenly food"
  pronunciation="doo LA-ver HIM-elsk math"
  example="Maden er himmelsk!"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Du g√∏r alt perfekt"
  translation="You do everything perfectly"
  pronunciation="doo yur alt per-FEKT"
  example="Admire their efforts."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Jeg kan lide, hvordan du g√∏r det"
  translation="I like how you do it"
  pronunciation="yai kan lee, vor-DAN doo yur det"
  example="Acknowledge their unique way."
/>

## Poetic Comparisons

<VocabCard
  word="Du er smuk som en rose"
  translation="You're beautiful like a rose"
  pronunciation="doo air smook som en ROO-se"
  example="Classic romantic comparison."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Du lyser som solen"
  translation="You shine like the sun"
  pronunciation="doo LOO-ser som SOO-len"
  example="You brighten everything."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Du er som en engel"
  translation="You're like an angel"
  pronunciation="doo air som en ENG-el"
  example="Du er min engel!"
/>

<CultureTip title="Danish Directness" flag="üá©üá∞">
Danes value honesty and directness. A simple, heartfelt compliment is worth more than flowery exaggerations. When you say something, mean it - your Danish partner will appreciate your authenticity.
</CultureTip>

## Responding to Compliments

When your partner compliments you, here's how to respond:

| Danish | Pronunciation | English |
|---------|---------------|---------|
| Tak | tak | Thank you |
| Du ogsa | doo OH-soh | You too |
| Du smigrer mig | doo SMEEG-rer mey | You flatter me |
| Virkelig? | VIR-ke-lee | Really? |
| Du er sa s√∏d | doo air soh sud | You're so sweet |
| Det er s√∏dt sagt | det air sut sagt | That's sweet to say |

## Daily Compliments to Use

Make it a habit to compliment your partner daily:

| Situation | Danish | English |
|-----------|---------|---------|
| Morning | Du ser godt ud | You look good |
| After cooking | Mums! / L√¶kkert! | Yummy! / Delicious! |
| Getting dressed | Det kl√¶der dig | It suits you |
| Working hard | Du er dygtig | You're good/capable |
| Being supportive | Tak fordi du er dig | Thanks for being you |
| Before bed | Jeg er heldig, at jeg har dig | I'm lucky to have you |

## Quick Reference: Essential Compliments

### For Her

| Danish | English |
|---------|---------|
| Du er smuk | You're beautiful |
| Du er dejlig | You're lovely |
| Du er fortryllende | You're enchanting |
| Du er klog | You're smart |
| Du er s√∏d | You're kind/sweet |

### For Him

| Danish | English |
|---------|---------|
| Du er flot | You're handsome |
| Du er st√¶rk | You're strong |
| Du er mandig | You're manly |
| Du er klog | You're smart |
| Du er s√∏d | You're kind/sweet |

### Universal

| Danish | English |
|---------|---------|
| Du er speciel | You're special |
| Jeg er stolt af dig | I'm proud of you |
| Du er alt for mig | You're my everything |
| Det er godt med dig | It's good with you |
| Du er den bedste | You're the best |

<CTA
  text="Ready to master these compliments? With Love Languages, your partner can send you Word Gifts with compliments in authentic AI voice. Practice with AI voice chat until you're confident. Your partner becomes your tutor!"
  buttonText="Start Learning Dansk"
/>

articles.title: –ü–æ–∂–µ–ª–∞–Ω–∏—è –Ω–∞ –≥–æ–¥–æ–≤—â–∏–Ω—É –Ω–∞ –∞–Ω–≥–ª–∏–π—Å–∫–∏–π: –†–æ–º–∞–Ω—Ç–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–∏–µ —Ñ—Ä–∞–∑—ã
articles.content:
import VocabCard from '@components/VocabCard.astro';
import CultureTip from '@components/CultureTip.astro';
import PhraseOfDay from '@components/PhraseOfDay.astro';
import CTA from '@components/CTA.astro';

–ü—Ä–∞–∑–¥–Ω–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏–µ anniversary –Ω–∞ –∞–Ω–≥–ª–∏–π—Å–∫–∏–π —è–∑—ã–∫–µ –¥–æ–±–∞–≤–ª—è–µ—Ç –ø—Ä–µ–∫—Ä–∞—Å–Ω—ã–π —Å–º—ã—Å–ª —ç—Ç–æ–º—É –æ—Å–æ–±–æ–º—É —Å–ª—É—á–∞—é. –ë—É–¥—å —Ç–æ –≤–∞—à –ø–µ—Ä–≤—ã–π –≥–æ–¥ together –∏–ª–∏ –∑–æ–ª–æ—Ç–∞—è anniversary, –≤—ã—Ä–∞–∂–µ–Ω–∏–µ –≤–∞—à–µ–π love –Ω–∞ —è–∑—ã–∫–µ –ø–∞—Ä—Ç–Ω—ë—Ä–∞ –¥–µ–º–æ–Ω—Å—Ç—Ä–∏—Ä—É–µ—Ç –∑–∞–±–æ—Ç—É –∏ –ø—Ä–µ–¥–∞–Ω–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—å –≤–∞—à–∏–º –æ—Ç–Ω–æ—à–µ–Ω–∏—è–º.

–î–ª—è –ø–æ–≤—Å–µ–¥–Ω–µ–≤–Ω—ã—Ö —Ä–æ–º–∞–Ω—Ç–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–∏—Ö –≤—ã—Ä–∞–∂–µ–Ω–∏–π –æ–∑–Ω–∞–∫–æ–º—å—Ç–µ—Å—å —Å –Ω–∞—à–∏–º —Ä—É–∫–æ–≤–æ–¥—Å—Ç–≤–æ–º [—Ä–æ–º–∞–Ω—Ç–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–∏–µ —Ñ—Ä–∞–∑—ã –Ω–∞ –∞–Ω–≥–ª–∏–π—Å–∫–∏–π –Ω–∞ –≤—Å–µ —Å–ª—É—á–∞–∏ –∂–∏–∑–Ω–∏](/blog/ru/english-romantic-phrases-for-every-occasion).

<PhraseOfDay
  word="Happy Anniversary"
  translation="–° –≥–æ–¥–æ–≤—â–∏–Ω–æ–π"
  pronunciation="Happy Anniversary"
  context="–ò–¥–µ–∞–ª—å–Ω—ã–π —Å–ø–æ—Å–æ–± –ø–æ–ø—Ä–∏–≤–µ—Ç—Å—Ç–≤–æ–≤–∞—Ç—å –ø–∞—Ä—Ç–Ω—ë—Ä–∞ –≤ –≤–∞—à –æ—Å–æ–±—ã–π –¥–µ–Ω—å."
/>

## –û—Å–Ω–æ–≤–Ω–∞—è –ª–µ–∫—Å–∏–∫–∞ –¥–ª—è –≥–æ–¥–æ–≤—â–∏–Ω—ã

<VocabCard
  word="anniversary"
  translation="–≥–æ–¥–æ–≤—â–∏–Ω–∞"
  pronunciation="anniversary"
  example="–°–µ–≥–æ–¥–Ω—è –Ω–∞—à–∞ anniversary!"
/>

| English | –†—É—Å—Å–∫–∏–π | –ò—Å–ø–æ–ª—å–∑–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏–µ |
|---|---|---|
| anniversary | –≥–æ–¥–æ–≤—â–∏–Ω–∞ | –û—Å–æ–±–∞—è –¥–∞—Ç–∞ |
| years | –≥–æ–¥—ã | –í—Ä–µ–º—è –≤–º–µ—Å—Ç–µ |
| together | –≤–º–µ—Å—Ç–µ | –ï–¥–∏–Ω—Å—Ç–≤–æ –∫–∞–∫ –ø–∞—Ä–∞ |
| forever | –Ω–∞–≤—Å–µ–≥–¥–∞ | –í–µ—á–Ω–∞—è –ª—é–±–æ–≤—å |
| love | –ª—é–±–æ–≤—å | –í–∞—à–∞ —Å–≤—è–∑—å |
| to celebrate | –ø—Ä–∞–∑–¥–Ω–æ–≤–∞—Ç—å | –û—Ç–º–µ—á–∞—Ç—å –¥–µ–Ω—å |
| memory | –≤–æ—Å–ø–æ–º–∏–Ω–∞–Ω–∏–µ | –î–æ—Ä–æ–≥–∏–µ –º–æ–º–µ–Ω—Ç—ã |
| milestone | –≤–µ—Ö–∞ | –í–∞–∂–Ω—ã–µ –æ—Ç–º–µ—Ç–∫–∏ |

<CultureTip flag="üá¨üáß" title="–¢—Ä–∞–¥–∏—Ü–∏–∏ –≥–æ–¥–æ–≤—â–∏–Ω—ã">
–í –∫—É–ª—å—Ç—É—Ä–∞—Ö, –≥–¥–µ –≥–æ–≤–æ—Ä—è—Ç –Ω–∞ –∞–Ω–≥–ª–∏–π—Å–∫–∏–π —è–∑—ã–∫–µ, –≥–æ–¥–æ–≤—â–∏–Ω—ã —á–∞—Å—Ç–æ –æ—Ç–º–µ—á–∞—é—Ç—Å—è —Ä–æ–º–∞–Ω—Ç–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–∏–º–∏ —É–∂–∏–Ω–∞–º–∏, –∑–Ω–∞—á–∏–º—ã–º–∏ –ø–æ–¥–∞—Ä–∫–∞–º–∏, –∞ –∏–Ω–æ–≥–¥–∞ –∏ –æ–±–Ω–æ–≤–ª–µ–Ω–∏–µ–º –∫–ª—è—Ç–≤. –ö–∞–∂–¥—ã–π —é–±–∏–ª–µ–π–Ω—ã–π –≥–æ–¥ –º–æ–∂–µ—Ç –∏–º–µ—Ç—å —Ç—Ä–∞–¥–∏—Ü–∏–æ–Ω–Ω—ã–µ —Ç–µ–º—ã –ø–æ–¥–∞—Ä–∫–æ–≤.
</CultureTip>

## –ü—Ä–æ—Å—Ç—ã–µ –ø–æ–∂–µ–ª–∞–Ω–∏—è –Ω–∞ –≥–æ–¥–æ–≤—â–∏–Ω—É

### –ö–æ—Ä–æ—Ç–∫–∏–µ –∏ —Å–ª–∞–¥–∫–∏–µ
- **Happy Anniversary!** - –° –≥–æ–¥–æ–≤—â–∏–Ω–æ–π!
- **–ï—â—ë –æ–¥–∏–Ω –ø—Ä–µ–∫—Ä–∞—Å–Ω—ã–π –≥–æ–¥ together!** - –ü—Ä–∞–∑–¥–Ω–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏–µ –≤—Ä–µ–º–µ–Ω–∏ –≤–º–µ—Å—Ç–µ
- **–ó–∞ –µ—â—ë –º–Ω–æ–≥–æ years!** - –°–º–æ—Ç—Ä—è –≤–ø–µ—Ä—ë–¥

### –î–ª—è –≤–∞—à–µ–≥–æ –ø–∞—Ä—Ç–Ω—ë—Ä–∞
- **–¢—ã –¥–µ–ª–∞–µ—à—å –∫–∞–∂–¥—ã–π –¥–µ–Ω—å –æ—Å–æ–±–µ–Ω–Ω—ã–º** - –í—ã—Ä–∞–∂–µ–Ω–∏–µ –±–ª–∞–≥–æ–¥–∞—Ä–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–∏
- **love —Ç–µ–±—è –±–æ–ª—å—à–µ —Å –∫–∞–∂–¥—ã–º –¥–Ω—ë–º** - –†–∞—Å—Ç—É—â–∞—è –ª—é–±–æ–≤—å
- **–ú–æ—ë —Å–µ—Ä–¥—Ü–µ forever —Ç–≤–æ—ë** - –í–µ—á–Ω–∞—è –ø—Ä–µ–¥–∞–Ω–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—å

<VocabCard
  word="love"
  translation="–ª—é–±–æ–≤—å"
  pronunciation="love"
  example="love —Å—Ç–∞–Ω–æ–≤–∏—Ç—Å—è —Å–∏–ª—å–Ω–µ–µ –∫–∞–∂–¥—ã–π –≥–æ–¥."
/>

## –†–æ–º–∞–Ω—Ç–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–∏–µ –ø–æ—Å–ª–∞–Ω–∏—è –Ω–∞ –≥–æ–¥–æ–≤—â–∏–Ω—É

### –°–µ—Ä–¥–µ—á–Ω—ã–µ –ø—Ä–∏–∑–Ω–∞–Ω–∏—è
**"–ö–∞–∂–¥–∞—è anniversary —Å —Ç–æ–±–æ–π –Ω–∞–ø–æ–º–∏–Ω–∞–µ—Ç –º–Ω–µ, –ø–æ—á–µ–º—É —è –≤—ã–±—Ä–∞–ª(–∞) —Ç–µ–±—è. –¢—ã –º–æ—ë forever."**

**"together –º—ã —Å–æ–∑–¥–∞–ª–∏ –ø—Ä–µ–∫—Ä–∞—Å–Ω—É—é –∂–∏–∑–Ω—å. –ó–∞ –µ—â—ë –º–Ω–æ–≥–æ years love."**

### –ó–∞–¥—É–º—á–∏–≤—ã–µ –ø–æ—Å–ª–∞–Ω–∏—è
**"–í—Å–ø–æ–º–∏–Ω–∞—è –Ω–∞—à–∏ memory, –º–æ—ë —Å–µ—Ä–¥—Ü–µ –Ω–∞–ø–æ–ª–Ω—è–µ—Ç—Å—è —Ä–∞–¥–æ—Å—Ç—å—é. –°–ø–∞—Å–∏–±–æ, —á—Ç–æ —Ç—ã –µ—Å—Ç—å."**

**"–ö–∞–∂–¥–∞—è milestone, –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä—É—é –º—ã –¥–æ—Å—Ç–∏–≥–∞–µ–º –≤–º–µ—Å—Ç–µ, –¥–µ–ª–∞–µ—Ç –Ω–∞—à—É —Å–≤—è–∑—å –∫—Ä–µ–ø—á–µ. –Ø to cherish –∫–∞–∂–¥—ã–π –º–æ–º–µ–Ω—Ç —Å —Ç–æ–±–æ–π."**

<CultureTip flag="üá¨üáß" title="–ù–∞–∑–≤–∞–Ω–∏—è —é–±–∏–ª–µ–µ–≤">
–†–∞–∑–Ω—ã–µ anniversary years –∏–º–µ—é—Ç —Ç—Ä–∞–¥–∏—Ü–∏–æ–Ω–Ω—ã–µ –Ω–∞–∑–≤–∞–Ω–∏—è: –ø–µ—Ä–≤–∞—è (–±—É–º–∞–∂–Ω–∞—è), –ø—è—Ç–∞—è (–¥–µ—Ä–µ–≤—è–Ω–Ω–∞—è), –¥–µ—Å—è—Ç–∞—è (–æ–ª–æ–≤—è–Ω–Ω–∞—è), –¥–≤–∞–¥—Ü–∞—Ç—å –ø—è—Ç–∞—è (—Å–µ—Ä–µ–±—Ä—è–Ω–∞—è) –∏ –ø—è—Ç–∏–¥–µ—Å—è—Ç–∞—è (–∑–æ–ª–æ—Ç–∞—è). –≠—Ç–∏ —Ç—Ä–∞–¥–∏—Ü–∏–∏ —Å—Ö–æ–∂–∏ –≤–æ –º–Ω–æ–≥–∏—Ö —Ä–µ–≥–∏–æ–Ω–∞—Ö, –≥–¥–µ –≥–æ–≤–æ—Ä—è—Ç –Ω–∞ –∞–Ω–≥–ª–∏–π—Å–∫–∏–π —è–∑—ã–∫–µ.
</CultureTip>

## –ü–æ—Å–ª–∞–Ω–∏—è –ø–æ –≥–æ–¥–∞–º

### –ü–µ—Ä–≤–∞—è –≥–æ–¥–æ–≤—â–∏–Ω–∞
**"–û–¥–∏–Ω –≥–æ–¥ love, —Å–º–µ—Ö–∞ –∏ —Å—á–∞—Å—Ç—å—è. –ü–µ—Ä–≤—ã–π –∏–∑ –º–Ω–æ–≥–∏—Ö –ø—Ä–µ–∫—Ä–∞—Å–Ω—ã—Ö years together!"**

### –ü—è—Ç–∞—è –≥–æ–¥–æ–≤—â–∏–Ω–∞
**"–ü—è—Ç—å years —Å–æ–∑–¥–∞–Ω–∏—è memory –≤–º–µ—Å—Ç–µ. –¢—ã –≤—Å—ë –µ—â—ë –≤—ã–∑—ã–≤–∞–µ—à—å —É –º–µ–Ω—è –±–∞–±–æ—á–µ–∫ –≤ –∂–∏–≤–æ—Ç–µ."**

### –î–µ—Å—è—Ç–∞—è –≥–æ–¥–æ–≤—â–∏–Ω–∞
**"–î–µ—Å—è—Ç–∏–ª–µ—Ç–∏–µ love! –ö–∞–∂–¥—ã–π –¥–µ–Ω—å —Å —Ç–æ–±–æ–π ‚Äî –ø–æ–¥–∞—Ä–æ–∫, –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä—ã–π —è to cherish."**

### –î–≤–∞–¥—Ü–∞—Ç—å –ø—è—Ç–∞—è –≥–æ–¥–æ–≤—â–∏–Ω–∞ (—Å–µ—Ä–µ–±—Ä—è–Ω–∞—è)
**"–î–≤–∞–¥—Ü–∞—Ç—å –ø—è—Ç—å years love –∏ —ç—Ç–æ —Ç–æ–ª—å–∫–æ –Ω–∞—á–∞–ª–æ. –¢—ã –º–æ—è –≤–µ–ª–∏—á–∞–π—à–∞—è milestone."**

### –ü—è—Ç–∏–¥–µ—Å—è—Ç–∞—è –≥–æ–¥–æ–≤—â–∏–Ω–∞ (–∑–æ–ª–æ—Ç–∞—è)
**"–ü—è—Ç—å–¥–µ—Å—è—Ç years together ‚Äî –∑–æ–ª–æ—Ç–∞—è –∏—Å—Ç–æ—Ä–∏—è love. –¢—ã –º–æ—ë forever."**

## –†–æ–º–∞–Ω—Ç–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–∏–µ —Ñ—Ä–∞–∑—ã –¥–ª—è –æ—Ç–∫—Ä—ã—Ç–æ–∫

| –°–ª—É—á–∞–π | –ü–æ—Å–ª–∞–Ω–∏–µ –Ω–∞ English | –ó–Ω–∞—á–µ–Ω–∏–µ |
|---|---|---|
| –õ—é–±–æ–π –≥–æ–¥ | Happy Anniversary –º–æ—è love | –° –≥–æ–¥–æ–≤—â–∏–Ω–æ–π, –ª—é–±–æ–≤—å –º–æ—è |
| –ü–µ—Ä–≤—ã–π –≥–æ–¥ | –ù–∞—à–∞ –ø–µ—Ä–≤–∞—è anniversary! | –ü—Ä–∞–∑–¥–Ω–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏–µ –ø–µ—Ä–≤–æ–≥–æ –≥–æ–¥–∞ |
| –û—Å–æ–±—ã–π –≥–æ–¥ | milestone anniversary | –í–∞–∂–Ω–∞—è –≥–æ–¥–æ–≤—â–∏–Ω–∞ |
| –ö–∞–∂–¥—ã–π –≥–æ–¥ | forever together | –í–µ—á–Ω–æ–µ –µ–¥–∏–Ω—Å—Ç–≤–æ |

## –ü–ª–∞–Ω–∏—Ä–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏–µ –ø—Ä–∞–∑–¥–Ω–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏—è –≥–æ–¥–æ–≤—â–∏–Ω—ã

### –†–æ–º–∞–Ω—Ç–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–∏–µ –∏–¥–µ–∏
1. –ù–∞–ø–∏—à–∏—Ç–µ –æ—Ç–∫—Ä—ã—Ç–∫—É –Ω–∞ –∞–Ω–≥–ª–∏–π—Å–∫–∏–π —è–∑—ã–∫–µ
2. –í—ã—É—á–∏—Ç–µ –ø–µ—Å–Ω—é –æ –ª—é–±–≤–∏ –Ω–∞ –∞–Ω–≥–ª–∏–π—Å–∫–∏–π
3. –ü—Ä–∏–≥–æ—Ç–æ–≤—å—Ç–µ —Ç—Ä–∞–¥–∏—Ü–∏–æ–Ω–Ω—ã–π —É–∂–∏–Ω
4. –°–ø–ª–∞–Ω–∏—Ä—É–π—Ç–µ –ø–æ–µ–∑–¥–∫—É –≤ —Å—Ç—Ä–∞–Ω—É, –≥–¥–µ –≥–æ–≤–æ—Ä—è—Ç –Ω–∞ –∞–Ω–≥–ª–∏–π—Å–∫–∏–π —è–∑—ã–∫–µ

### –í—ã—Ä–∞–∂–µ–Ω–∏–µ –±–ª–∞–≥–æ–¥–∞—Ä–Ω–æ—Å—Ç–∏
- **–°–ø–∞—Å–∏–±–æ –∑–∞ –∫–∞–∂–¥—ã–π –¥–µ–Ω—å** - –ó–∞ –µ–∂–µ–¥–Ω–µ–≤–Ω—É—é —Ä–∞–¥–æ—Å—Ç—å
- **–Ø –±–ª–∞–≥–æ–¥–∞—Ä–µ–Ω(–Ω–∞) –∑–∞ –Ω–∞—à—É –∂–∏–∑–Ω—å –≤–º–µ—Å—Ç–µ** - –ó–∞ –≤–∞—à–µ –ø–∞—Ä—Ç–Ω—ë—Ä—Å—Ç–≤–æ
- **–¢—ã ‚Äî –ª—É—á—à–µ–µ, —á—Ç–æ —Å–ª—É—á–∏–ª–æ—Å—å —Å–æ –º–Ω–æ–π** - –°–∞–º—ã–π –≥–ª—É–±–æ–∫–∏–π –∫–æ–º–ø–ª–∏–º–µ–Ω—Ç

## –°–æ–æ–±—â–µ–Ω–∏—è –¥–ª—è —Å–æ—Ü–∏–∞–ª—å–Ω—ã—Ö —Å–µ—Ç–µ–π

### –ü–æ–¥–ø–∏—Å–∏ –¥–ª—è –ø—É–±–ª–∏–∫–∞—Ü–∏–π
- **X years —Å undefined** - –í–µ—Ö–∞
- **together forever** - –ü—Ä–æ—Å—Ç–æ–µ –∏ —Å–ª–∞–¥–∫–æ–µ
- **Happy Anniversary –º–æ–µ–π –≤—Ç–æ—Ä–æ–π –ø–æ–ª–æ–≤–∏–Ω–∫–µ** - –¢—Ä–∞–¥–∏—Ü–∏–æ–Ω–Ω–æ–µ

## –ö—Ä–∞—Ç–∫–∏–π —Å–ø—Ä–∞–≤–æ—á–Ω–∏–∫
